resourceId.description: This is the data element to be used in the path when retrieving data from a dedicated account.

name.description: Name of the account given by the bank or the PSU in Online-Banking.

product.description: Product Name of the Bank for this account, proprietary definition.

sortCode.description: Bank codes used in British and Irish banking systems.

msisdn.description: A number uniquely identifying a subscription in a Global System for Mobile communications or a Universal Mobile Telecommunications System mobile network.

_links.description: A list of hyperlinks to be recognized by the TPP.

get.description: Retrieve the information of the accounts

parameters.name: withBalance
parameters.description: If contained, this function reads the list of accessible payment accounts including the booking balance, if granted by the PSU in the related consent and available by the ASPSP. This parameter might be ignored by the ASPSP.

get.description: Reads details about an account, with balances where required. It is assumed that a consent of the PSU to this access is already given and stored on the ASPSP system. The addressed details of this account depends on the stored consent addressed by consentId, respectively the OAuth2 access token.
Read transaction reports or transaction lists of a given account addressed by account_id, depending on the steering parameter bookingStatus together with balances.
Reads account data from a given account addressed by account_id

Reads a list of card accounts with additional information, e.g. balance information. It is assumed that a consent of the PSU to this access is already given and stored on Salt Edge Compliance system. The addressed list of card accounts depends on the PSU ID and the stored consent addressed by consentId.

Reads details about a card account. It is assumed that a consent of the PSU to this access is already given and stored on the Salt Edge Compliance system. The addressed details of this account depends on the stored consent addressed by consentId.

Reads details about a card account. It is assumed that a consent of the PSU to this access is already given and stored on the Salt Edge Compliance system. The addressed details of this account depends on the stored consent addressed by consentId.

Reads details about a card account. It is assumed that a consent of the PSU to this access is already given and stored on the Salt Edge Compliance system. The addressed details of this account depends on the stored consent addressed by consentId.

X-Request-ID.name: X-Request-ID
X-Request-ID.description: ID of the request, unique to the call, as determined by the initiating party.

Digest.name: Digest
Digest.description:
Contains a Hash of the message body, if the message does not contain a body,
the "Digest" header must contain the hash of an empty string - "".

Psu-ID.name: Psu-ID
Psu-ID.description: Client ID of the PSU in the ASPSP client interface.

Psu-Corporate-ID.name: Psu-Corporate-ID
Psu-Corporate-ID.description: Only used in a corporate context.

TPP-Signature-Certificate.name: TPP-Signature-Certificate
TPP-Signature-Certificate.description:
The certificate used for signing the request, in base64 encoding that should comply with RFC 4648
(No line feeds).

Signature.name: Signature
Signature.description: A signature of the request by the TPP on application level. This might be mandated by ASPSP.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: The media type of the body of the request.

Consent-Id.name: Consent-Id
Consent-Id.description: ID of the corresponding consent object as returned by an Account Information Consent Request.

TPP-Redirect-URI.name: TPP-Redirect-URI
TPP-Redirect-URI.description: URI of the TPP, where the transaction flow shall be redirected to after a Redirect. Mandated for the Redirect SCA Approach, specifically when TPP-Redirect-Preferred equals "true". It is recommended to always use this header field.

TPP-Redirect-Preferred.name: TPP-Redirect-Preferred
TPP-Redirect-Preferred.description: If it equals "true", the TPP prefers a redirect over an embedded SCA approach. If it equals "false", the TPP prefers not to be redirected for SCA. The ASPSP will then choose between the Embedded or the Decoupled SCA approach, depending on the choice of the SCA procedure by the TPP/PSU. If the parameter is not used, the ASPSP will choose the SCA approach to be applied depending on the SCA method chosen by the TPP/PSU.

dateFrom.name: dateFrom
dateFrom.description: Starting date (inclusive the date dateFrom) of the transaction list, mandated if no delta access is required.

dateTo.name: dateTo
dateTo.description: End date (inclusive the data dateTo) of the transaction list, default is "now" if not given.

bookingStatus.name: bookingStatus
bookingStatus.description: Permitted codes are booked, pending and both. booked shall be supported by the ASPSP.

tppMessages.text: Invalid input. More info in error_message
This request cannot be performed without Certificate header.
The consent was created by this TPP but has expired and needs to be renewed.
The consent was created by this TPP but has expired and needs to be renewed.
The Consent-ID cannot be matched by the ASPSP relative to the TPP.
This request cannot be performed without Signature header.
Action you want to perform is not allowed. More in error_message
The addressed resource is unknown relative to the TPP.
The addressed resource is unknown relative to the TPP.
